snippet: The number of planes scrambled by the country’s defense forces had surged in recent years, nearly matching such activity during the Cold War amid growing activity by China and Russia in the region.
abstract: Japan's Self Air-Defense Force has scrambled jets 943 times in year ending on March 31, 2015, driven by increased Russian and Chinese activity in region; number falls just short of country's record for such flights set in 1984.
lead_paragraph: The number of planes scrambled by the country’s defense forces had surged in recent years, nearly matching such activity during the Cold War amid growing activity by China and Russia in the region.

headline.main: Japan: Tensions in the Region Keep Defense Forces’ Jets Busy
headline.print_headline: Asia; Japan: Tensions in the Region Keep Defense Forces’ Jets Busy
